subject: PACS
title: Christianity, Violence, and the Bible
description: Why has the Bible inspired so much violence? This course explores how it has been used to justify, and to oppose, violence within the Christian tradition in historical and contemporary contexts. Topics may include the crusades, slavery, colonization, apartheid in South Africa, the residential school system in Canada, gender violence, and the environmental crisis. [Note: This course fulfils an Area 3 requirement for Religious Studies majors.]
